thread.title: At first sign of trouble, DJ drops the hammer
thread.title_full: At first sign of trouble, DJ drops the hammer

author: nbcsports.com
title: At first sign of trouble, DJ drops the hammer
text:
For the first time this week, Dustin Johnson found himself in a tense situation, all square with Alex Noren after the Swede rolled in a 40-footer for birdie at the 12th hole   Play. 
Save for when he had been standing on the first tee , Johnson had not trailed nor been tied as he cruised through group play and the Round of 16. 
How the world No. 1 responded to his first taste adversity was almost as impressive as his dominance to that point. 
Johnson rolled in a 9-footer for birdie at No. 13, an 11-footer for birdie at No. 15, and closed the match out on the 16th hole with a 4 1/2-foot birdie putt for a 3-and-2 victory. 
He still hasn’t played Nos. 17 and 18 in a match. 
“I knew Alex was going to be a tough opponent. I wasn't frustrated that I was all square,” Johnson said. “I came back, made a nice birdie on 13 and won that hole and then birdied 15 and 16 to win, too. Came back strong after losing three holes in a row.” 
Johnson will face Hideto Tanihara in Sunday’s semifinal round and can become the first player to win all four World Golf Championships and his third consecutive start. Article Tags:
